thread.title: Thirsty Merc to resume tour after crash
thread.title_full: Thirsty Merc to resume tour after crash

title: Thirsty Merc to resume tour after crash
text:
Thirsty Merc announce they will continue tour after fatal crash killed crew member and injured drummer Kathy McCabe National Music Writer News Corp Australia Network Thirsty Merc announce they will continue tour after fatal crash killed crew member and injured drummer Kathy McCabe National Music Writer News Corp Australia Network Tour On ... Thirsty Merc will resume their Good Life tour in Canberra next week. Picture: Supplied. 
THIRSTY Merc will resume their national tour next week after farewelling stage manager Shane Cooper at a memorial service in Sydney. 
The band have been mourning the well-respected industry figure and supporting drummer Mick Skelton as he continues to recover from last week’s fatal car accident in rural Victoria as the band headed to a concert in Warnambool. 
The band decided to get back on the road so they could donate some of their ticket sales to Cooper’s grief-stricken family and assist Skelton’s recovery. 
They are also planning a benefit concert in the coming weeks which is expected to feature some of Cooper and Skelton’s closest musical mates. Tough times ... The band will support Cooper and Skelton’s families with proceeds from ticket sales. Picture: Supplied. 
The band posted an emotional message to fans to announce they would resume The Good Life tour at the ANU Bar in Canberra on Wednesday. 
“It’s been a really hard time for us. There were moments where we seriously questioned whether we’d be walking out on stage at all for the rest of the year,” they said. Other Stories
